events.name: Networking in Data Center World 2015
events.description: This is a good opportunity for data center professionals to see the showcase of Datwyler data center solutions, as well as do networking.  Please feel free to invite your colleagues and friends to come along.   Pls inform our booth attendance that you come by invitation from this meetup forum, or show your reservation.  We'll have a special presentation & gift for you.   See you there. Senjaya
events.location: Suntec Convention Centre Level 4, Datwyler booth G04, Singapore

events.name: Clojure Meetup #4 'Tales from Production, Clojure in the Wild
events.description:
Hi fellow Singaporean Clojurians, Firstly I must apologise for the irregularity of the recent meetups, personal situations conspired to prevent us organising any. However things are now back on track and we have a meetup this month and we will also have a meetup earlier than usual in November as part of DevFest Singapore. The announcement for that will go out within a week and we will have our first international speaker talking about ClojureScript at that.  This time we're back with tales from the real world, where The Brave and True have deployed Clojure in anger successfully. We have 2 speakers and promise stimulating and true stories of the successes and issues around using Clojure in high performance, high availability and mission critical software. One of the most difficult things in getting your shop or workplace to adopt a new language is being able to figure out what it does well and what it does not. It's always a bit of a chicken and egg situation as to be able to do it you have to have done it already so benefit from the experience of our two speakers Liu Dapeng and Marcus Bradstreet to help you. The talks are: "The Clojure brain behind 40 billion requests a day, a story of deploying clojure into production" by Liu Dapeng. Dapeng is a software developer of 10 years experience who has been using Clojure for three years. He has built and deployed a key component of his employer's, PocketMath, ad management system in clojure and this is that story with comparisons to Java, how clojure worked and didn't, the unexpected  wins and losses including time travelling and the challenges of getting a new language accepted by his management. 



"Clojure Embraces Pragmatism" by Lucas Bradstreet. Lucas is a software developer of many moons and has been working with Clojure for more than 2 years. His talk is about the how Clojure is a language for getting stuff done primarily and not proving academic or style points. His talk will demonstrate how Clojure is more than any other language a language for developers who care about shipping product. ThoughtWorks have kindly stepped up and offered their offices for the meetup on Amoy St.  PocketMaths are kindly sponsoring the Pizza and drinks.
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore

events.name: Hackware v1.2
events.description:
Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. 

Our talks typically include side projects by speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things, radio frequency and much more! Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on.

7pm food and drinks will start! Pizza, wine and soft drinks are provided thanks to General Assembly Singapore.

Agenda & Talks for this meetup from 7:30pm:

1. (10min) Homemade HEPA Air Filter - Xong Sing Yap

2. (20min) FPGA: The basics - Brahim Hamadicharef
Prelude to the FPGA.SG v0.1 Meeting / Workshop October 2015

3. (30min + Q&A) Orchard Dev Board - Bunnie Huang
http://www.kosagi.com/w/index.php?title=Orchard_Main_Page

4. Short demos:
- (2min) IoT hardware with Meteor Javascript - Rick Behl
- (5min) BOSSO Robot - Masakazu Tks Takasu
- (5min) Ultimate Hacking Keyboard - Nikolai Lebedovsky
https://www.crowdsupply.com/ugl/ultimate-hacking-keyboard

5. Announcements
- Electronics to share (Frequency Generator Kit - FG085 by Baoshi Zhu)
- Hiring positions
- Available for hire
- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else

6. Socialize and Network with other Hackware members

Talks : ~20mins
Lightning Talks : ~5mins
Announcements: ~1min

Sponsors:
events.location: General Assembly Singapore, The Working Capitol, 1 Keong Saik Road, Level 3, Singapore 089101 (Turn left on the side lane beside Lollapalooza and walk up to level 3)

events.name: Virtual Reality TL;DR with OSVR Demo
events.description:
For this meetup, we expect guests from OSVR (Open Source Virtual Reality) with their high end Hacker Kit. You can be one of the first in Singapore, who will try it. Have you ever come across something new in VR but you don't have the HMD for it? Or you want to create something for VR but you can't find someone to work together with? Use this event to collaborate, jam out new VR project ideas, form a VR project team, record a VR videos or find out more about VR websites, videos, games and apps. We will break the participants in groups and you guys decide what you guys want to do. VR TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates. Helps to bring a laptop for the event. Please install the VR games, apps or sdk that you are interested to share or work on before the event. After that, each group will share what they learned, tried or build. You guys can bring your VR input/output too. Please let us know. We will put it on the list. Expected VR input output. Oculus Rift DK2 x 1 Real Sense x 1 Kinect windows x 1 Structure io 3d scanner x 1 cardboard x 4 Epson moverio x 1 Agenda 7.15 pm - OSVR intro - Marquis, Dev Relations from Razer, OSVR 7.30 pm - R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new 9.30 pm - Q&A: share what your team learned 10.00pm - Announcement (You can announce your VR/AR project, job posting, or available for hire) 





In Partnership with
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951
events.group_name: Asia VR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality meetup
